alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Lower Iberia; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Southern Acadia; St. Landry; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 7:28AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Iberia, Lafayette, eastern Acadia, central Vermilion, northwestern St. Martin and southeastern St. Landry Parishes through 830 AM CDT... At 728 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cankton to near Kaplan to 11 miles north of Pecan Island. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, New Iberia, Opelousas, Crowley, Abbeville, Catahoula, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, St. Martinville, Kaplan, Church Point, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Forked Island, Intracoastal City, Avery Island and Broussard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 82 and 128. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lafayette; Lower Iberia; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Southern Acadia; St. Landry; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper Vermilion
